thread.title: Ciara Wilson dresses baby belly in tight black dress | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Ciara Wilson dresses baby belly in tight black dress | Daily Mail Online

author: Sameer Suri For Dailymail.Com
title: Ciara Wilson dresses baby belly in tight black dress | Daily Mail Online
text: comments Ciara enjoyed a stroll in Beverly Hills on Friday, wearing a tight black top that emphasized her bulging baby bump. Letting her blonde hair tumble over her shoulders, the 31-year-old wore tortoiseshell butterfly sunglasses and skintight black leggings. Black and white shoes completed the look for the pregnant singer, who announced her second and current pregnancy in October. On the way: Ciara enjoyed a stroll in Beverly Hills on Friday, wearing a tight black top that emphasized her bulging baby bump The man behind the baby bump is Seattle Seahawk Russell Wilson, whom she married three months before announcing she was expecting. She's previously had a now two-year-old son called Future Zahir Wilburn by the rapper Future, to whom she was engaged from 2013 to 2014. Though she and Wilson dated for over a year, they waited to consummate their relationship until they finally married last summer. The casual 90210 look: Letting her blonde hair tumble over her shoulders, the 31-year-old wore tortoiseshell butterfly sunglasses and skintight black leggings Ciara opened up about that decision in the February issue of Cosmopolitan South Africa , having posed on the magazine's cover. 'I really believe that when you focus on a friendship, you have the opportunity to build a strong foundation for a relationship – and once you know you’re really great friends and you’re what we call @equally yoked," where you share the same values or the same outlook on life, it kind of sets the tone,' she said. 'Knowing that you’ll always have the friendship and that you can always go back to it is very important, and very powerful.' Building a family: The man behind the baby bump is Seattle Seahawk Russell Wilson, whom she married three months before announcing she was expecting She's also said that 'I have to give credit to my husband for sharing those views. It’s awesome how it all worked out.' The I Bet singer expounded on gender difference, saying: 'Here’s how it works. We women think with our hearts and with our minds. When we see a guy, we envision what he’s like and whether this could be something special. Guys see us from an exterior point of view – that’s something I learnt along the way as a woman.' In her view, 'It’s important to have a friendship. It’s important to have standards. You shouldn’t feel like you have to give your body away to get someone to like you.' Cover girl: In the February issue of Cosmopolitan South Africa this year, she opened about about her and her husband's decision to abstain until marriage, saying: 'You shouldn’t feel like you have to give your body away to get someone to like you' Share or comment on this article 63
